channel.title: STILL NEED HELP (and i need help on how to reinstall grub) on ubuntu
channel.description:
hey when i updated my computer the booting thing didnt updated sucsefully and now i cant boot my linux :( can anyone help me with how to get booted MY ubuntu ? i have booted ubuntu from the cd but i cant seem to find any thing in grub (the booting programm) so please anyone got an idea off what i should do? EDIT: and i was stupid :( i didnt got backups off my 25 GB music or 10 GB pics so i dont want to loose them...
please help me :)
Ps: im typing on my dad's computer :)
KNEISTOL :P

item.title: STILL NEED HELP (and i need help on how to reinstall grub) on ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @kneistol kneistol
item.description:
@kneistol wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:16, topic:320298”]No, then you are guessing about where grub is installed, this is how you find out:

http://www.google.com/search?q=restore+grub

First result:
http://www.sorgonet.com/linux/grubrestore/

Basically, with an ubuntu livecd, or anything with sudo, type this:

sudo grub
find /boot/grub/stage1
# the above command tells you something like (hd0,1) hd0 in this case is the drive, 1 is the partition
# the following assumes the above told you (hd0,1), if it is different change it for 
root (hd0,1)
setup (hd0)
quit
sudo reboot

now your computer should reboot, with grub this time (as long as your bios boots from the drive you installed grub on)[/quote]

yeah everyone thx but i say when i updtaed grub the files got lost and now i dont got a single grub file
so how can i poosible find a grub file?
when i search i only get errors

Read full topic

item.source: STILL NEED HELP (and i need help on how to reinstall grub) on ubuntu

item.title: STILL NEED HELP (and i need help on how to reinstall grub) on ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

No, then you are guessing about where grub is installed, this is how you find out:

http://www.google.com/search?q=restore+grub

First result:
http://www.sorgonet.com/linux/grubrestore/

Basically, with an ubuntu livecd, or anything with sudo, type this:

sudo grub
find /boot/grub/stage1
# the above command tells you something like (hd0,1) hd0 in this case is the drive, 1 is the partition
# the following assumes the above told you (hd0,1), if it is different change it for 
root (hd0,1)
setup (hd0)
quit
sudo reboot

now your computer should reboot, with grub this time (as long as your bios boots from the drive you installed grub on)

Read full topic
item.source: STILL NEED HELP (and i need help on how to reinstall grub) on ubuntu

item.title: STILL NEED HELP (and i need help on how to reinstall grub) on ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

  1. Pop in the Live CD, boot from it until you reach the desktop.
  2. Open a terminal window or switch to a tty.
  3. Type “grub”
  4. Type “root (hd0,6)”, or whatever your harddisk + boot partition numbers are (my /boot is at /dev/sda7, which translates to hd0,6 for grub).
  5. Type “setup (hd0)”, ot whatever your harddisk nr is.
  6. Quit grub by typing “quit”.
  7. Reboot.

Source:
Second reply to this topic: http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-24113.html

Read full topic

It Still Works

How to Turn Safe Mode Off Locally

Safe mode is a boot option available in most Windows operating systems. This mode is generally used for troubleshooting purposes. If an application is causing errors in normal mode, starting the system in safe mode allows you to determine whether the...

but at step 3 when i type in the thing it says there i get errors becuz all my files are missing[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 21, 2009, 06:35:49 am[/size][hr]i found som more but i think i will try the live cd first

Make Tech Easier – 11 Apr 08

How To Restore Grub In Ubuntu

If you install a dual boot of Windows or Mac OSX on your Ubuntu machine, you may find that your Grub bootloader are wiped out and you can’t boot into any of your OS. If this is the case, the only way is to restore Grub back in your Ubuntu system....

live cd
http://linuxpoison.blogspot.com/2008/09/how-to-restore-grub-with-ubuntu-live-cd.html

idk waht but something

nixCraft – 15 Aug 05

Restore Debian Linux Grub boot loader - nixCraft

Recently my hard disk went bad (some bad sectors developed), my boot.ini (Windows XP boot file) corrupted. I was using NT boot loader to load Linux. So I need to repair the Grub i.e. restore Grub in master boot record (MBR). Today is national holiday...

hey the reason for posting the websites here is that then i dont have to put the adress on memory sticks or find them again
so when im posting here i can just clieck them and get there
